bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from Hal R. Keeling to Philip Showalter Hench, January 18, 1948

div1.p: Keeling reports to Hench that he has found a good deal of material, including a transcript of Reed's talk. He will bring a description of the material when he visits Hench next Sunday.

div1.head: Letter from Hal R. Keeling to Philip Showalter Hench, January 18, 1948
div1.opener:
answered 1/19/48.
HAL R. KEELING
5519 NORTH MERIDIAN STREET
INDIANAPOLIS
1/18/48
DEAR PHIL-
div1.p:
WE HAVE LOCATED A LOT
OF MATERIAL, INCLUDING A HORSE-
AND-BUGGY PHOTO OF THE OLD
GERMAN HOUSE.

ALSO FOUND COMPLETE
TRANSCRIPT OF DR. REED'S TALK
IN LOCAL ARCHIVES, THEY WON'T
LET US TAKE IT OUT, BUT WE
CAN SEND A SECRETARY OVER
TO COPY IT - IF IT TURNS OUT
TO BE SOMETHING YOU DON'T HAVE.

WILL BRING PHOTO, ONE
BOOK, AND DESCRIPTION OF ALL
OTHER MATERIAL, WITH ME
WHEN I COME UP NEXT SUNDAY.
(HAVE DATE WITH HAINES NEXT
MONDAY 1/26/48 AND WILL LIKELY LEAVE
TUESDAY NIGHT.)

WE'LL GO OVER ALL THIS
STUFF TOGETHER... THIS IS
FUN!

closer.seg:
P. S. KAHLER WON'T PROMISE BETTER
THAN A SINGLE WITHOUT BATH. MR.
LANG VERY NICE, DOING HIS BEST. I
HOPE HE FINDS A ROOM WITH BATH.
